NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.(n)

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Iida Masashige creates immersive video presentations for dome-shaped projection screens that hang overhead in planetariums and other theaters. He talks about his vision, themes, and methods.(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Beauty
programme.desc: The Shigaraki ware is pottery that originated in 13th century Japan. Its rustic appeal has long been adored by tea ceremony practitioners and everyday people alike for ages; tune in to find out why.(n)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.(n)

programme.title: NEWSLINE IN DEPTH
programme.desc: Introducing a colorful variety of feature stories, including reports on daily life from locations throughout Japan, as well as other parts of Asia and around the world.(n)

programme.title: BENTO EXPO
programme.desc: Maki makes a tri-colored karaage bento, and Marc demonstrates a trick for preparing perfectly juicy shrimp. Bento Trip features a popular Japanese-style bento delivery service in Brazil.(n)

programme.title: Easy Japanese for Work
programme.desc: Today: explaining a need for staffing adjustment. Kaung Htet Paing, from Myanmar, works at Narita Airport. In a roleplay challenge, he reports to a supervisor that a coworker is unwell.(n)

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: This program gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.(n)

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Kubota Ryo runs a biotech startup that is working with NASA to develop a device that can test for the eye problems to which astronauts are susceptible. Kubota shares his vision with us.(n)

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Two Scenic Views
programme.desc: We break down a print that warps space to allow the viewer to be in two places at once: Shinobazu Pond, known for its lotus flowers, and the Sumida River, one of Edo's busiest waterways.(n)

programme.title: NHK Documentary
programme.desc: Since the 8th century, Buddhist monks at Nara's Todaiji have held the annual Shuni-e ritual. In 2021, the COVID pandemic threatens to keep this ancient tradition from happening for the 1,270th time.(n)

programme.title: TIME-LAPSE JAPAN
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a variety of short programs focusing on Japan and Asia.(n)

programme.title: JAPAN FROM ABOVE: UP CLOSE
programme.desc: This program takes you on an aerial journey across 21st century Japan. Enjoy the bird's-eye view of unique landscapes as well as intimate portraits of the people who inhabit the archipelago.(n)
